page.title: 112 KEMPSTON LOWER SCHOOLS
page.content: {A. CAMESTONE SCHOOL It was opened in{1977}for 5 to 9 yr. olds. Its{name}derives from the{old {spelling of Kempston.}The building includes a hall, 4 classrooms and other rooms. In 1985 4 new classrooms were built, with additional office and storage areas plus an extended play- ground area. The catchment area covers the urban area of New Town between Bedford and Elstow Roads. {B. KEMPSTON RURAL SCHOOL It was built in{1844}& is now a listed building leased from the Diocese of St Albans. A wide variety of books and modern equipment is used including TV, calculators and a computer provided by the Kempston Charities.The PTA built a playground by the river and a swimming pool.The children play games on a tree lined field with bullocks as onlookers & enjoy nature walks & growing plants.
